title: Using Bayesian parameter estimation to learn more from data without black boxes
excerpt: An invited Comment piece evangelizing BPE!

title: Nonequilibrum Electrochemical Phase Maps: Beyond Butler-Volmer Kinetics
excerpt: (Software for) Building phase stability maps for any electrochemical kinetic model

title: AutoMat: Automated materials discovery for electrochemical systems
excerpt: I co-lead an invited perspective piece summarizing our ARPA-E DIFFERENTIATE project on electrochemical materials discvoery.

title: A Minimal Information Set To Enable Verifiable Theoretical Battery Research
excerpt: Giant collaboration to try to set some standards for verifiability/reproducibility in theoretical/computational battery research.

title: Marcus-Hush-Chidsey Kinetics at Electrode-Electrolyte Interfaces
excerpt: My first real contribution in electrochemistry! And some fun Julia coding to boot.

title: How much physics is in a current-voltage curve? Inferring defect properties from photovoltaic device measurements
excerpt: Last big chunk of my PhD work, fitting SRH parameters for iron in silicon using Bayesian parameter estimation

title: Computational frameworks to enable accelerated development of defect-tolerant photovoltaic materials
excerpt: My PhD thesis! Now available online through MIT DSpace.

title: Bayesim: a tool for adaptive grid model fitting with Bayesian inference
excerpt: Code release paper for Bayesim, my Bayesian inference Python package. For more information, see the [website](https://pv-lab.github.io/bayesim/_build/html/index.html).

title: Structural and Chemical Features Giving Rise to Defect Tolerance of Binary Semiconductors
excerpt: This was my first lead-author publication! It describes the core of my defect tolerance work that will appear in my PhD thesis.

title: A-site cation in inorganic A$_3$Sb$_2$I$_9$ perovskite influences structural dimensionality, exciton binding energy, and solar cell performance
excerpt: This is a primarily experimental paper which was led by my former postdoc mentor, Juan-Pablo Correa-Baena (now a professor at GA Tech!). He was having some interesting problems with phase impurities in the samples he was growing and I performed some DFT calculations to help explain the observations.

title: Solvent-Engineering Method to Deposit Compact Bismuth-Based Thin Films: Mechanism and Application to Photovoltaics
excerpt: I contributed some DFT calculations to this paper.

title: Rapid semiconductor device characterization through Bayesian parameter estimation
excerpt: This was our first paper on the Bayesian inference work, led primarily by my former grad student mentor Riley. He designed the study, we both wrote some of the code, and I did most of the data analysis.

title: Strongly Enhanced Photovoltaic Performance and Defect Physics of Air-Stable Bismuth Oxyiodide (BiOI)
excerpt: Another joint experimental-computational paper. I ran some DFT defect energy calculations for this work.

title: High Tolerance to Iron Contamination in Lead Halide Perovskite Solar Cells
excerpt: I contributed DFT defect calculations to this work, helping to determine the most likely sites and charge states of iron defects in hybrid lead halide perovskites.

title: Searching for ``Defect-Tolerant'' Photovoltaic Materials: Combined Theoretical and Experimental Screening
excerpt: This was a big capstone of our early materials search efforts. I worked on the defect calculations and also grew the bismuth iodide samples.

title: Perovskite-inspired photovoltaics: Best practices in materials characterization and calculations
excerpt: I participated in the workshop that led to this (GIANT author list!) paper, in particular the XRD part.

title: Economically sustainable scaling of photovoltaics to meet climate targets
excerpt: A really cool collaborative effort to apply our existing technoeconomic models towards climate change goals. I helped collate data and design the analysis.

title: Segmentation and Tracking of Marine Cellular Clouds observed by Geostationary Satellites
excerpt: A paper that grew out of my summer research at the Weizmann Institute back in 2011 and used some of the code I wrote back then.

title: Methylammonium bismuth iodide as a lead-free, stable hybrid organic-inorganic solar absorber
excerpt: I worked on characterization for this paper.

title: Investigation of Bismuth Triiodide (BiI$_3$) for Photovoltaic Applications
venue: The Journal of Physical Chemistry Letters
excerpt: Early materials search efforts. I helped build the furnace, grow samples, and do characterization for this work.
